title.value: A Pilot Study of a Novel Carbon Fibre Breast Support Device in Radiotherapy
title.justification: The paper involves a pilot study regarding a new carbon fibre breast support device used during radiotherapy
title.quote: Materials and Methods: Twenty breast patients participated in a pilot study of a novel carbon fibre breast support device.

extractions.description: This paper presents a pilot study on a novel carbon fibre breast support device used in breast radiotherapy. It discusses the methodology and results of tests conducted with human subjects, focusing on dose distribution and the prediction of moist desquamation (MD) using a logistic model.

type.justification: The paper involves a practical study with 20 patients and generates observable metrics and results.
type.quote: Materials and Methods: Twenty breast patients participated in a pilot study of a novel carbon fibre breast support device.

name.justification: The research focuses on a breast support device used in radiotherapy treatments.
name.quote: This dose-distance metric has been shown to predict specific regions of skin expected to develop MD in breast radiotherapy.

name.justification: The study specifically targets breast cancer treatment methodologies.
name.quote: This dose-distance metric has been shown to predict specific regions of skin expected to develop MD in breast radiotherapy.

name.value: Logistic Model for Predicting Moist Desquamation
name.justification: The logistic model is specifically mentioned as being modified and developed for predicting MD in the study.
name.quote: A logistic model was modified and developed to predict MD, accounting for the spatial distribution of measured skin dose.

is_contributed.justification: The paper states the model was modified and developed as part of the study.
is_contributed.quote: A logistic model was modified and developed to predict MD, accounting for the spatial distribution of measured skin dose.

is_executed.justification: The study applied the logistic model to 20 patient data sets to test predictions.
is_executed.quote: Parameters were tested by applying the metric on the 20 patient skin dose distributions.

is_compared.justification: The focus was on testing the logistic model, without mentioning a direct comparison with other models.
is_compared.quote: A logistic model was modified and developed to predict MD, accounting for the spatial distribution of measured skin dose.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Predictive modeling is central to this study, as evidenced by the adaptation and application of a logistic model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A logistic model was modified and developed to predict MD, accounting for the spatial distribution of measured skin dose.
